Package modelCheckCTL.utils

Class Utils

java.lang.Object
modelCheckCTL.utils.Utils
public class Utils
extends java.lang.Object
Generic utility methods for dealing with States, Transitions, CTL labels, Sets and some other miscellaneous items. The state utilities here are: isStateName, getStatesStr, getState and statesWithLabel. The transition utilities here are: getTransition and getTransitionsStr. The label utility here is: getLabelsStr The set utilities here are: contains, containsStateName, areEqual, copy, intersection, union and subtract. The miscellaneous utilities here are: removeByteOrderMark, handleError and isTxtFile

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • getStatesStr

      public static java.lang.String getStatesStr​(java.util.Set states) throws java.io.IOException
      Gets the names of states in a Set and returns them in a comma separated string with a colon at the end." The states are sorted ascending by each state's number. This is used for printing out Kripke contents and also for just printing out state set contents.
      Parameters:
      states - The states that one needs the names of outputted
      Returns:
      a string formatted like this "s1, s2, s3;"
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • getState

      public static State getState​(java.lang.Integer stateNum, java.util.Set states) throws java.io.IOException
      Gets a state from a state set, given its state number. Throws IOExceptionError if state is not found. Throws NullPointerError if either param is null.
      Parameters:
      stateNum - Integer of state needed from state set
      states - The Set of States one needs a particular state from
      Returns:
      the State from the state set, if found
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • statesWithLabel

      public static java.util.Set statesWithLabel​(java.util.Set states, Token t) throws java.io.IOException
      Takes a JavaCC Token of a CTL label and searches through a Set of States for any states with that label
      Parameters:
      states - is a Set of States of which we want to know if any of the states contain the specified label
      t - Token of a label of which we want to know which states have it
      Returns:
      the Set of States which contain the specified label
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • getTransition

      public static Transition getTransition​(java.lang.Integer transitionNum, java.util.Set transitions) throws java.io.IOException
      Gets a transition from a transition set, given its transition number. Throws IOExceptionError if state is not found. Throws NullPointerError if either param is null.
      Parameters:
      transitionNum - Integer of state needed from state set
      transitions - The Set of Transitions one needs a particular transition from
      Returns:
      the Transition from the transition set, if found
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • getTransitionsStr

      public static java.lang.String getTransitionsStr​(java.util.Set transitions) throws java.io.IOException
      Gets the names of transitions in a Set and returns them in a multiline format like: t1 : s1 - s2, t2 : s1 - s3; The transitions are sorted ascending by each state's number. This is used for printing out Kripke contents.
      Returns:
      returns a multiline like: t1 : s1 - s2, t2 : s1 - s3;
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • getLabelsStr

      public static java.lang.String getLabelsStr​(java.util.Set states)
      Gets a label string from a Set of labels (a label is just a Character p-z) in format like: s1 : p q, (propositional atom names are separated by a space; a name consists of letters, it is casesensitive) s2 : q t r, s3 : , (i.e. set of propositional atoms for state s3 is empty) s4 : t;
      Parameters:
      states - A Set of labels (a label is just a Character
      Returns:
      Gets a label string from a Set of labels (a label is just a Character p-z) in format like: s1 : p q, (propositional atom names are separated by a space; a name consists of letters, it is casesensitive) s2 : q t r, s3 : , (i.e. set of propositional atoms for state s3 is empty) s4 : t;

    • contains

      public static java.lang.Boolean contains​(java.util.Set states, State state)
      Checks if a set of States has a certain state in it. Takes the "needle" state and uses the number field and searches for that number in the "haystack" states of the set. Note that only a state of the same state number is checked for. ie, 1 for s1. So this is not checking for the exact state by memory address. This is a loose implementation - might have to change this when I add Jung GUI back in
      Parameters:
      states - set of States to be searched for the state
      state - a State to be checked if it is in the set of states
      Returns:
      true if state is in set, false otherwise

    • containsStateName

      public static java.lang.Boolean containsStateName​(java.util.Set states, java.lang.String stateName)
      Checks if a set of States has a certain state in it by using the supplied state name as the "needle" and searching for that name field on all the "haystack" states of the set Note that only a state of the same state name is checked for. ie, "s1". So this is not checking for the exact state by memory address. This is a loose implementation - might have to change this when I add Jung GUI back in
      Parameters:
      states - set of States to be searched for the state
      stateName - a String to be checked if it is in the set of states' name fields
      Returns:
      true if state is in set, false otherwise

    • areEqual

      public static java.lang.Boolean areEqual​(java.util.Set setA, java.util.Set setB)
      Tests if two sets of states are "equal", ie. do they each have the same number of states and does the second set have a state with the same num as a state in the first set Note that only a state of the same state number is checked for. ie, 1 for s1. So this is not checking for the exact state by memory address. This is a loose implementation - might have to change this when I add Jung GUI back in
      Parameters:
      setA - set of States to be compared to setB
      setB - set of States to be compared to setA
      Returns:
      true if sets are the same size and they have states of the same state numbers.

    • copy

      public static java.util.Set copy​(java.util.Set set)
      Copies a Set of States. Iterates through the set and instantiates an new state for each state found. The instantiated state has the same number value, name value, but obviously has a new memory address. The same goes for all the transitions - they are re-instantiated one by one using the same number value, from value and to value, but the transition has a different memory address than the original. The copied labels, on the other hand, have the same memory address.
      Parameters:
      set - is a Set of States to be copied
      Returns:
      a Set of States with the same number, name, labels and transitions. The state itself as well as the Transitions all have different memory addresses than the originals. The copied labels on the states have the same memory addresses as the original labels.

    • intersection

      public static java.util.Set intersection​(java.util.Set a, java.util.Set b)
      Set intersection operation. Takes two Sets of States and returns the states in both. If set a is {1,2,3} and set b is {2,3,4} the intersection of a and b returns {2,3}.
      Parameters:
      a - first Set of States for the intersection operation
      b - second Set of States for the intersection operation
      Returns:
      the Set of States which are in both supplied sets. If set a is {1,2,3} and set b is {2,3,4} the intersection of a and b returns {2,3}.

    • union

      public static java.util.Set union​(java.util.Set a, java.util.Set b)
      Set union operation. Takes two Sets of States and returns one set with all the states in either set. If set a is {1,2,3} and set b is {2,3,4} the union of a and b returns {1,2,3,4}.
      Parameters:
      a - first Set of States for the union operation
      b - second Set of States for the union operation
      Returns:
      the Set of States which in either set. If set a is {1,2,3} and set b is {2,3,4} the union of a and b returns {1,2,3,4}.

    • subtract

      public static java.util.Set subtract​(java.util.Set a, java.util.Set b) throws java.io.IOException
      Set subtraction operation. Takes two Sets of States and returns all the states in the second set which are not in the first. If set a is {1,2,3} and set b is {2,3,4} then a subtract b returns {4}.
      Parameters:
      a - first Set of States for the subtraction operation
      b - second Set of States for the subtraction operation
      Returns:
      the Set of States of all the states in the second set which are not in the first. If set a is {1,2,3} and set b is {2,3,4} then a subtract b returns {4}.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • removeByteOrderMark

      public static java.lang.String removeByteOrderMark​(java.lang.String str)
      This removes an invisible "byte order mark" from a string. I believe some of the test files have this byte order mark, which was manifesting as a space character or something. The only way to remove the space was by using this code to remove the byte order mark. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Byte_order_mark for more details on the byte order mark This code approach to removing byte order marks from https://www.postgresql.org/message-id/20180717101246.GA41457%40elch.exwg.net
      Parameters:
      str - String to remove the byte order mark from
      Returns:
      the same String as the param, but with the byte order mark removed

    • handleError

      public static void handleError​(java.lang.String errorMessage, java.lang.Boolean printExceptions) throws java.lang.Exception
      For debugging vs production. For debugging, we want to throw exception and halt program. For production, we want to print the error and keep going
      Parameters:
      errorMessage - is a String of the message we want to throw/print
      printExceptions - Boolean of whether to print the exceptions to the console and not stop the program (true) or if we want to throw an exception and stop the program there (false)
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • isTxtFile

      public static java.lang.Boolean isTxtFile​(java.lang.String str) throws java.io.IOException
      Checks if String ends in .txt and has at least one character before the period. Throws NullPointerException if String is null.
      Parameters:
      str - The String one wants to check if it ends in .txt
      Returns:
      false if string doesn't match the conditions above, otherwise returns true.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
